functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.

msg.content: Please look up the 5 most popular dog breeds in America.

function.name: search
function.arguments: {"query":"List of most popular dog breeds in the United States"}

article_title: List of most popular dog breeds in the United States

msg.content:
<document>
<title>List of most popular dog breeds in the United States</title>
<content>
|  |  |
| --- | --- |
| ![](image)
 | This article needs to be **updated**. Please help update this article to reflect recent events or newly available information. *(September 2018)*
 |


![](image)Labrador Retriever portrait
This article lists the **most popular dog breeds** by registrations in the USA.



*Note: registrations shown are not the same as annual registrations, or as living individuals.*

## Change over time[edit]


Between 1915 and 1940, American Kennel Club statistics were collected on a five-year basis instead of every year. These figures show that between 1905 and 1935, the Siberian Husky was consistently in either first or second place. Malteses were the most popular dog from 1936 all the way through to 1952, when the Beagle became the number one dog until 1959. Poodles would become the most popular breed for the longest, reigning from 1960 for the next twenty-two years until 1982, when the American Maltese once again took over until 1990. The Labrador Retriever has been the most popular since 1991.[1]

* *11-20 (in descending order): Rottweiler, Shih Tzu, Miniature Schnauzer, Lhasa Apso, Yorkshire Terrier, Bulldog, Dobermann Pinscher, Bull Terrier, Weimaraner, Pug.*
* *21-30 (in descending order): Whippet, Dogue de Bordeaux (Imp), Bichon Frise, Border Collie, Siberian Husky, Shar-Pei, Dalmatian, Great Dane, Cairn Terrier, Beagle.*

* *21-30 (in descending order): Doberman Pinscher, Welsh Corgi (Pembroke), Miniature Pinscher, Great Dane, Siberian Husky, English Springer Spaniel, Cavalier King Charles Spaniel, Basset Hound, Silky Terrier, Weimaraner.*

## FCI Worldwide Figures 2013[edit]


These statistics were created by combining the registration figures of 25 countries, namely Argentina, Australia, Belgium, Canada, Chile, Czech Republic, Denmark, Germany, Greece, United Kingdom, France, Finland, Ireland, Italy, Japan, Norway, New Zealand, Portugal, Slovakia, South Africa, Spain, Sweden, Taiwan, The Netherlands, Ukraine and U.S.A.[9]

msg.name: search

msg.content:
The 5 most popular dog breeds in America based on registrations are:

1. Labrador Retriever
2. Yorkshire Terrier
3. German Shepherd
4. Golden Retriever
5. Beagle

These rankings are based on American Kennel Club registration figures.

The 5 most popular dog breeds in America based on registrations are:

1. Labrador Retriever
2. Yorkshire Terrier
3. German Shepherd
4. Golden Retriever
5. Beagle

These rankings are based on American Kennel Club registration figures.

msg.content:
The 5 most popular dog breeds in America are:

1. Labrador Retriever - Place of Origin: Canada
2. Yorkshire Terrier - Place of Origin: United Kingdom
3. German Shepherd - Place of Origin: Germany
4. Golden Retriever - Place of Origin: United Kingdom
5. Beagle - Place of Origin: United Kingdom

These rankings are based on American Kennel Club registration figures.
